briefdescription.para: A type alias for a function that validates a Dictionary object.

detaileddescription.para: This type alias represents a function that takes a Dictionary object as an argument and returns a boolean value indicating whether the Dictionary is valid or not.

memberdef.definition: using NeoN::Executor = typedef std::variant<SerialExecutor, CPUExecutor, GPUExecutor>
memberdef.name: Executor

briefdescription.para: Validates that a field is registered in the database.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the field.
The field to validate.
if the field is not registered in the database.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a Dictionary object has an "id" key.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks if the given Dictionary object has an "id" key.

parameterdescription.para: The Dictionary object to check.

simplesect.para: true if the Dictionary has an "id" key, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the name of a Document.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the name of the Document by looking up the "name" key in the Document's Dictionary object.

parameterdescription.para: The Document to retrieve the name from.

simplesect.para: std::string The name of the Document.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the name of a Document.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the name of the Document by looking up the "name" key in the Document's Dictionary object.

parameterdescription.para: The Document to retrieve the name from.

simplesect.para: std::string The name of the Document.

memberdef.name: logOutRange

briefdescription.para: Checks if two executors are equal, i.e. they are of the same type.

parameterdescription.para: The first executor.
The second executor.

simplesect.para: True if the executors are equal, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if two executors are not equal, i.e. they are not of the same type.

parameterdescription.para: The first executor.
The second executor.

simplesect.para: True if the executors not are equal, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Arithmetic add operator, addition of two fields.

parameterdescription.para: The field to add with this field.
The field to add with this field.

briefdescription.para: Arithmetic subtraction operator, subtraction one field from another.

parameterdescription.para: The field to subtract from.
The field to subtract by.

memberdef.name: map

briefdescription.para: Map a field using a specific executor.

parameterdescription.para: The field to map.
The function to apply to each element of the field.
The range to map the field in. If not provided, the whole field is mapped.

memberdef.argsstring: (Field< ValueType > &a, const std::type_identity_t< ValueType > value, std::pair< size_t, size_t > range={0, 0})
memberdef.name: fill

briefdescription.para: Fill the field with a scalar value using a specific executor.

parameterdescription.para: The field to fill.
The scalar value to fill the field with.
The range to fill the field in. If not provided, the whole field is filled.

memberdef.name: setField

briefdescription.para: Set the field with a span of values using a specific executor.

parameterdescription.para: The field to set.
The span of values to set the field with.
The range to set the field in. If not provided, the whole field is set.

briefdescription.para: Compute segment offsets from an input field corresponding to lengths by computing a prefix sum.

detaileddescription.para: The offsets are computed by a prefix sum of the input values. So, with given input of {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} the offsets are {0, 1, 3, 6, 10, 15}. Note that the length of offSpan must be length of intervals + 1 and are all elements of offSpan are required to be zero

parameterdescription.para: The values to compute the offsets from.
The field to store the resulting offsets in.

briefdescription.para: creates a mesh containing only a single cell @warn currently this is only a 2D mesh

detaileddescription.para: a 2D mesh in 3D space with left, right, top, bottom boundary faces with the centre at (0.5, 0.5, 0.0) left, top, right, bottom faces and four boundaries one left, right, top, bottom

briefdescription.para: A factory function for a 1D mesh.

detaileddescription.para: A 1D mesh in 3D space in which each cell has a left and a right face. The 1D mesh is aligned with the x coordinate of Cartesian coordinate system.
